entry.title: 100xdevs-cohort-2/paytm-project-starter-monorepo
entry.summary:
Turborepo starter

This is an official starter Turborepo.

Using this example

Run the following command:

npx create-turbo@latest

What's inside?

This Turborepo includes the following packages/apps:

Apps and Packages

  • docs: a Next.js app
  • web: another Next.js app
  • @repo/ui: a stub React component library shared by both web and docs applications
  • @repo/eslint-config: eslint configurations (includes eslint-config-next and eslint-config-prettier)
  • @repo/typescript-config: tsconfig.jsons used throughout the monorepo

Each package/app is 100% TypeScript.

Utilities

This Turborepo has some additional tools already setup for you:

  • TypeScript for static type checking
  • ESLint for code linting
  • Prettier for code formatting

Build

To build all apps and packages, run the following command:

cd my-turborepo
pnpm build

Develop

To develop all apps and packages, run the following command:

cd my-turborepo
pnpm dev

Remote Caching

Turborepo can use a technique known as Remote Caching to share cache artifacts across machines, enabling you to share build caches with your team and CI/CD pipelines.

By default, Turborepo will cache locally. To enable Remote Caching you will need an account with Vercel. If you don't have an account you can create one, then enter the following commands:

cd my-turborepo
npx turbo login

This will authenticate the Turborepo CLI with your Vercel account.

Next, you can link your Turborepo to your Remote Cache by running the following command from the root of your Turborepo:

npx turbo link

Useful Links

Learn more about the power of Turborepo:

  • Tasks
  • Caching
  • Remote Caching
  • Filtering
  • Configuration Options
  • CLI Usage

entry.title: lisandrascruz/PretaLab-c10-Disney-LP-Projeto
entry.summary:
Projeto: Adivinha√™

Ol√°,

Vamos iniciar um jogo de adivinha√ß√£o projeto final do m√≥dulo de l√≥gica de programa√ß√£o do ciclo 10.

Funcionalidades do Adivinha√™

----- Momento guiado -----

  1. N√£o aceitar palpites vazios.
  2. Dar dicas a cada palpite errado.
  3. Atualizar a pontua√ß√£o a cada palpite errado.
  4. Mostrar todos os palpites errados do jogo para evitar que repitam o erro.
  5. Possibilidade de poder reiniciar o jogo a qualquer momento.
  6. Se a pontua√ß√£o chegar a zero, deve ser exibido um alerta e o jogo reiniciado.

----- Momento individual -----

  1. S√≥ deve aceitar numeros entre 1 e 100.
  2. N√£o deve aceitar palpite repetido. Ou seja, o usu√°rio deve ser alertado de que j√° tentou esse palpite, n√£o devemos contar como palpite, nem adicionar na lista de palpites errados.
  3. Publicar no netlify

Instru√ß√µes

Para come√ßar a praticar, siga estes passos:

  1. Crie um fork e Clone o reposit√≥rio para sua m√°quina local.
  2. Abra o arquivo index.html em seu navegador para acessar o Adivinha√™.

Recursos Adicionais

  • Durante o projeto guiado, preste aten√ß√£o e siga o fluxo, caso contr√°rio voc√™ ter√° que fazer todas as funcionalidades sozinha depois.
  • Explore o c√≥digo existente para maior entendimento.
  • Cuidado ao mexer no html, css e scripts. Esses arquivos comp√µes a base do seu c√≥digo e altera√ß√µes podem quebrar o c√≥digo. Se souber o que est√° fazendo fique a vontade <3

Estrutura de Pastas:

- assets/
- src/
  - index.js
  - script.js
- index.html
- styles.css
- README.md

Diagrama de Organiza√ß√£o do Projeto:

      +-----------------+---+--
      |   projeto Adivinha√™   |
      +--------+--------+---+---
               |
               v
      +-----------------+
      | assets/         |
      |  background.png |
      |  magic-wand.png |
      +-----------------+
               |
               v
      +-----------------+
      |  src/           |
      |    script.js    |
      |    index.js     |
      +-----------------+
               |
               v
      +-----------------+
      |    styles.css   |
      +-----------------+
               |
               v
      +-----------------+
      |   index.html    |
      +-----------------+
               |
               v
      +-----------------+
      |    README.md    |
      +-----------------+

Passo a Passo para realizar a sua entrega do Projeto

Certifique-se de seguir cada passo cuidadosamente para garantir que suas contribui√ß√µes sejam integradas ao reposit√≥rio original.

  • Fork do Reposit√≥rio:

    • Acesse o reposit√≥rio de origem.
    • No canto superior direito da p√°gina, clique no bot√£o "Fork" para criar uma c√≥pia do reposit√≥rio para sua conta.

  • Clone do Fork na Sua M√°quina:

    • No seu perfil do GitHub, acesse o fork do reposit√≥rio que voc√™ acabou de criar.
    • Clique no bot√£o verde "Code" e copie o URL fornecido.
    • Abra o terminal ou prompt de comando no diret√≥rio onde deseja clonar o reposit√≥rio.
    • Execute o comando git clone URL-do-seu-fork.

  • Prepare-se para as mudan√ßas:

    • Navegue para o diret√≥rio do projeto usando o comando cd nome-do-reposit√≥rio ou abra a pasta de forma visual.

  • Inserir sua Resposta:

    • Dentro da pasta "src", localize o arquivo script.js.
    • Edite o arquivo implementando as funcionalidades.

  • Adicione as Mudan√ßas:

    • Para adicionar todas as altera√ß√µes, execute o comando git add .
    • Se preferir adicionar apenas um arquivo espec√≠fico, use git add nome_do_arquivo.

  • Commit das Mudan√ßas:

    • Commit cada mudan√ßa fa√ßa um commit utilizando o comando git commit -m "Mensagem do commit".

  • Envie as Altera√ß√µes para o GitHub:

    • Envie os commits para sua branch usando o comando git push.

  • Publique no netlify

Conclus√£o

Agora voc√™ est√° familiarizado em como criar uma aplica√ß√£o usando a triade web: html, css e javascript. Experimente personalizar e expandir este projeto para ser parte do seu portif√≥lio pessoal. A pr√°tica √© a chave para entendermos cada vez mais a l√≥gica de programa√ß√£o!

Divirta-se jogando e enviando seu jogo para os amiguinhas atrav√©s da url do netlify! Se tiver d√∫vidas ou precisar de ajuda, n√£o hesite em nos contatar.

entry.title: anuragverma108/SwapReads
entry.summary:
This repo is officially accepted for GSSOC'2k24. SwapReads.com is the ultimate online destination for book enthusiasts to connect, exchange favorite reads, and embark on literary adventures. Create your profile, list the books you're eager to swap, and join a vibrant community of passionate readers.

SwapReads.com

Connect, Exchange, Explore ‚Äì Where Book Enthusiasts Swap Books and Discover New Literary Adventures!

üåü Stars üç¥ Forks üêõ Issues üîî Open PRs üîï Close PRs
SwapReads.com is the solution to common challenges faced by book enthusiasts in today's digital age. We've identified key problems and developed a platform that addresses them efficiently and effectively.

Featured In

Event Logo Event Name Event Description
GirlScript Summer of Code 2024 GirlScript Summer of Code is a three-month-long Open Source Program conducted every summer by GirlScript Foundation. It is an initiative to bring more beginners to Open-Source Software Development.

The Problem:

  1. Limited Book Access:

    • Many readers struggle to find a variety of books locally.

  2. Book Expenses and Sustainability:

    • Buying new books is expensive, and the environmental impact of book production is a concern.

  3. Lack of Personalized Recommendations:

    • Generic book recommendations from algorithms lack a personal touch.

  4. Social Isolation in Reading:

    • Reading has become a solitary activity, with readers missing out on sharing thoughts and discoveries.

  5. Unused Book Collections:

    • Readers often have books that are read and then set aside, collecting dust.

How SwapReads.com Solves These Problems:

  1. Global Book Exchange:

    • SwapReads.com connects users globally, allowing them to exchange books regardless of location.

  2. Cost-Effective and Sustainable Reading:

    • By swapping books, users reduce expenses and contribute to a more sustainable reading culture.

  3. Personalized Recommendations and Community Trust:

    • Users share favorite reads, providing and receiving personalized recommendations from a trusted community.

  4. Social Connection and Book Discussions:

    • Features like private messaging and community forums foster a social environment for book discussions.

  5. Revitalizing Unused Book Collections:

    • SwapReads.com encourages users to share and exchange books that are sitting idle on their shelves.

üíª Tech Stacks

Ready to Contribute?

Kindly go through CONTRIBUTING.md to understand everything from setup to contributing guidelines.

If you would like to contribute to the project, please follow our contribution guidelines.

Open Innovation Challenge:

SwapReads.com actively participates in the Open Innovation Challenge by cultivating a global community of readers. Our platform champions open access to a wide range of books, promotes sustainable reading habits through book swapping, and harnesses user-generated content to offer personalized recommendations. With community-driven discussions and data-driven optimizations, SwapReads.com is committed to advancing the goals of inclusivity, sustainability, and collaborative innovation in the world of literature.

Join SwapReads.com today and embark on a literary journey like never before!

üîó Contact Us

Role LinkedIn Discord Email
Project Admin LinkedIn Discord anuragvermacontact@gmail.com
Mentor LinkedIn Discord amanraj12.ar@gmail.com
Mentor LinkedIn Discord ritichandak@gmail.com

Code of Conduct

Please note that this project is released with a Contributor Code of Conduct. By participating in this project you agree to abide by its terms.

Our Contributors

Thank you for contributing to our repository
